entry.title: The Clark Kent Disappearance
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,411Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: For two days, the world goes on without Superman. No sightings, no messages—just silence. Bruce Wayne tells himself not to care. He’s handled alien invasions, godlike beings, and Gotham rush hour. But the absence of one man manages to unravel every layer of calm he pretends to have. When Clark finally reappears—smiling, soot-streaked, and completely unaware of the panic he’s caused—Bruce’s carefully buried worry comes to the surface. What begins as a sharp exchange over communication habits turns into something quieter: a conversation about fear, control, and what it means to love someone who flies into danger every day. Between arguments, awkward humor, and a rooftop kiss interrupted by the Bat-Signal, The Clark Kent Disappearance is a story about two men learning that “I love you” can sound a lot like “You could’ve texted.”

entry.summary:
Author: imanaddictiveiguess

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,512Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 46

Summary: Eons upon eons have passed since Hadrian "Harry Potter" Black became Death's master. Now expertly wielding powers that preside over both death and magic throughout all of existence and his world now long gone; Hadrian after mourning his friends and long lost world eventually took Death's offer and stayed by their side balancing the cosmos. Now millennia afterwards Death saw it fit to drop him in a new reality where super heroes and villains exist often facing world ending disasters like every other Tuesday. His new duty is that he must help keep this universe from imploding on itself all while on "vacation". No big deal…right?

Summary: Bruce's brow fully arched upwards, the edges of his own lips curving slightly upwards into the ghost of a coy grin. "Really?" "You want to take control today, is that it?"Clark tilted his head to the side, his grin turning a bit smug. "Yes, actually. I was thinking, since you've been making all these big decisions and bossing people around all day, that you might like getting a break, where you don't have to think about anything.
